name: Team 5 Final Project
tagline: the IST 412 team five final project - to connect the BES particle simulator to an external controller
body:
### How to connect to this project:
### 1) Download .zip (_it's a NetBeans project_), put it anywhere
### 2) Open project in NetBeans
### 3)under Team at the top, select "initialize repository"
just put this in the same folder as the project (it the default)
### 4) under Team at the top, select "commit"
### 5) under Team at the top, select Remote -> pull (not pull from upstream)
the first choice selected is the local git, we want the second one. 
set the url to: 
https://github.com/hancharik/team5midiLights.git
### 6) under Team at the top, select "commit"
That's it, you are good to go!





![bes particle simulator](http://www.personal.psu.edu/mah537/ist412/images/bessq.png)
### Team Five Final Project
We will be connecting the BES particle simulator to an external controller, midi and motion if time allows
![microsoft kinect](http://www.personal.psu.edu/mah537/ist412/images/team5stages.png)
### Establishing a connection
MIDI is an obvious choice, as there are enough variables to allow for some interesting changes to the particles in real time.  Connecting to a camera controller such as Microsoft Kinect [Book on open source programming for the Kinect](http://www.amazon.com/Kinect-Open-Source-Programming-Secrets/dp/0071783172/ref=sr_1_5?ie=UTF8&qid=1445871834&sr=8-5&keywords=Microsoft+Kinect+3d+Motion+Controller) or using the camera on an Android phone would allow the user to control the light show with their hands (We only need to be able to access control for the mouse listener and a click event). Shining the screen at maximum brightness in a dark room could make for some interesting effects, although the dark room might require use of the accelerometer.

![a shitty little single-axis mind controlled helicopter](http://www.personal.psu.edu/mah537/ist412/images/mcrms.png)
### Why MIDI? 
controlling the particle variables in real time with midi will be the main goal. It will be a good environment for running tests  (4 midi channels and 5-10 variables) 
MIDI isn't about music, it's about multi-variable controllers. If we can connect to these particles, we can connect to any variable in any program, or even an airframe or robotic arm.

 [5 axis control for about $400](https://emotiv.com/store/epoc-detail/)
